content: bottom to a st on the circle count 30 sts around the circle and pin this st to the middle of the bottom where you ve placed a stitch marker already and then count another 30 sts and pin the other end row of the bottom here b count 9 sts/row down from the ending pins on each side and pin the full circle and bottom pieces together here too the space between these pins and the ending pins is where your belt will run you can make it larger or smaller by adjusting the number of sts depending on what belt s you are planning on wearing with your bag c when pinning sides together you may choose to align your join if visible so it is either in the back of the bag or will be covered by the vine pattern 3 single_crochet the full circle and bottom pieces together between the lower pins on each side 42 st 4 on one side single_crochet the full circle and bottom pieces together at the top pinned st/row single_crochet 1 again in the next st in the circle but into the same st in the bottom piece to turn the corner single_crochet 1 in the next st in the circle but the same st in the bottom piece now on the top not the side of the bottom piece then single_crochet 1 in the next 3 st/row along the top 6 st into 6 st in the full circle and 4 st in the bottom piece 5 vine pattern and attaching leaves a pin leaves where you think you will want them b to make vines slip_stitch along the surface of the bag in any pattern you want including loops/curves close to the bases of your leaves c leaves should be sewn on in three places at the base through one loop of a sl st in the vine at the middle and at the tip of the leaf where the picot is located the rest should be left loose for a 3d effect 6 button closure a sew your button onto the half circle piece just above the st marker in the middle of the bottom piece b create a chain just long enough to fit loosely around the circumference of your button leaving tails on each end mine was 16 chain long c fold the chain in half and place the middle over the center of your button place a marker on the front flap of your bag where the ends of the chain touch d sew the chain onto the underside of the front flap of your bag at the marker location using the tails you left 7 thread a belt through your bag and admire your finished project
